author: Petrichor13
title: Rude and Unhelpful
body: Over the last 2 weeks I have been trying to quit my dependence on nicotine lozenges and as I had been advised to quit cold turkey due to a serious physical health issue, I thought I would try to get a little moral support from this service. The first lady I spoke to on 2 occasions was very helpful and kind. Over the last 2 days and nearing the end of the 2nd week of my quit I was seriously struggling so I spoke to my very helpful GP who advised that I should try a nicotine patch and taper down over the next few weeks, and that the symptoms I am struggling with are 100% related to severe nicotine withdrawal from having gone cold turkey off a relatively high (26mg) of nicotine per day. So today, I phoned the helpline again for a chat and some support and spoke to another advisor who was appallingly rude to the point of reducing me to tears when I came off the phone. Stated that they thought it was 'very unusual, very strange' that my GP thought my symptoms were due to nicotine withdrawal, implying that they either didn't believe that I had spoken to my GP or that my GP didn't know how to diagnose nicotine withdrawal. I told the advisor that my GP had advised the patch which I am buying myself, and again was rudely told that I was too hung up on things and that I wasn't suffering from nicotine withdrawal as it should be all out of your system after 3 days - that it was all anxiety and that I should concentrate on that. What this advisor didn't know was that my GP had already discussed with me anxiety as one of my quit symptoms and had told me that anxiety is one of the most prominent symptoms of withdrawal for the first 2 to 4 weeks and possibly up to the first 3 months to a lesser extent, so I had indeed been screened by a qualified medical professional who deemed that I was not suffering from 'just anxiety' in isolation which I had brought on myself as I clearly was experiencing other nicotine withdrawal symptoms in addition. I felt belittled and not listened to. I feel that it is extremely worrying that an advisor on this helpline would force an opinion over that of my medically qualified GP, and have been very upset by my experience.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Patient 73
title: Attendance at Day Procedures Ward
body:
I attended the Day Procedures Unit in March and April 2021.  
As a former senior staff member in the Health Service I would have a detailed knowledge of sevices and the standards of care required for an effective service.  
My treatment consisted of IV Infusions for Ulcerative Colitis.  
My overall impression of the facility and standards of nursing care were excellent.  
The environment was bright and spacious which was conducive in itself. Care began punctually on each occasion as planned. The nursing staff demonstrated a high level of competence. They were professional at all times, pleasant and friendly. Any questions I had about the treatment were answered clearly. Health and Safety practice was also of a high standard, especially with the current Covid situation. I noted that two Open University student nurses on placement were very well supported by nursing staff.  
In conclusion, my impression was of an excellent facility with excellent nursing staff

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmze58
title: An accident at work
body: In November 2020, my husband had an accident at work. We just want to say a special thank you to all the staff involved in his care. The ambulance operators, rapid response, paramedics and A&E Craigavon. To the IV coordinators Pauline and Susan and the ICT team in Dungannon. Thank you all so much for your amazing care, support and professionalism in what have been challenging times.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: mazworld15
title: Thank you all at Room D
body: On behalf of my dad, can we say a huge thank you to the nurses in Room D radiotherapy for their care and compassion towards him. He loved ringing the bell!

author: corriemutt
title: Covid: people not using masks in A&E
body:
I recently attended Ninewells A&E and there were people (patients) not wearing masks or not wearing them properly (pulling down below their mouths for the whole time they were in waiting area) and then acting in a way that felt I and other people in the waiting room could be put at risk of covid (coughing/speaking/talking/laughing really loudly/moving around the area so at risk of spreading covid even if they were asymptomatic).  
I didn't feel confident enough to ask these people to keep their masks on as I was with my child and did not want to antagonise them as they were quite loud but there didn't seem to be anything in place from the NHS point of view to check whether people were sticking to covid guidance when attending A&E at Ninewells.  
It made me and my child really anxious to be in this situation - we were there there for a non-covid reason (stressful enough) and followed guidance but potentially put at risk by other people in the waiting area not following covid guidance (even more stressful).

author: earthy34
title: Much better second experience
body:
Despite being very busy the midwives kept me informed throughout the labour so I could make decisions. When they saw I was scared because of the outcome of a previous birth they looked up the notes and explained what happened with my first birth. I wish someone had done this two years ago! I felt they understood what I wanted to avoid happening again. I felt they were very much on my team. I was on my own due to restrictions with childcare but I think it went better with just the midwifery care rather than having my husband present!  
The disappointing elements of the experience had nothing to do with the care or expertise of the staff. Instead, there were a number of times that technology let the staff down. There were issues with the drips not working and then something I needed to be able to move about wasn't working so I couldn't leave the side of the bed. It's a shame that the staff don't have the reliable equipment that they need. The hospital was also extremely busy. Staff were clearly working very hard but they were constantly searching for equipment that wasn't in the right places and services were delayed. Fortunately I didn't need much support afterwards but it would have been scary if I was a first time mum. They did acknowledge that it was a very busy time to give birth.  
Despite a bit of drama in early labour and the technology meaning I couldn't move about in labour as I wanted, the actual delivery went better than I could have imagined. I think I may have actually enjoyed the pushing!

author: norrie  d
title: Operation for enlarged prostrate
body:
I had a prostrate operation in April 2021 at ward 7 Perth Royal Infirmary  
Talk about tonic, The Humour from staff would give anyone a boost prior to surgery.From the Anaesthetist team , Surgery team & Nursing staff etc, Mr Martindale & his team were most professional in everything, they carried out,  
The nursing staff on returning to ward 7 were magnificent in everything from care to humour , nothing was too much bother to them, they carried out their duties to the letter & beyond, a special word of praise for Nurse Kirsty - she carried out her duties exceptionally well. Never needed any pain killers , removal of catheter was painless, all scans etc carried out most professionally, these people are a great credit to the profession, Thank you with all my heart

author: Pau21
title: Respected my wishes
body:
From the time I was contacted about having my procedure done, everyone has been exceptional in the way they have dealt with me.  
Many options were explained about pain relief and they always respected my wishes.  
Everyone on the endoscopy unit were fantastic and I couldn’t fault them at all, many thanks to the team

author: Nanny poms pom
title: My operation
body: I really can't fault the staff on ward 2 of Grantham hospital.   From the consultant to the handy man. Everyone was polite, informative, respectful and caring. I was in for breast cancer surgery any worries or fears were honestly answered and explained. The nursing staff are second to none. Proffesional, caring and nothing was too much trouble. I would highly recommend this ward.   I'm now home recovering and have had follow up phone call from breast unit to make sure I'm ok. The staff on the front line work hard but still manage to keep going without dropping the standards. Well done ward 2 from a very grateful. Tina Martin

author: scoreboardsc45
title: COVID vacination
body: Prompt, efficient service at the vaccination centre in Lerwick.   All staff very helpful and explained procedure in detail including any after side effects.

author: Alfie1
title: Very happy
body: Very good pleased with the IHTT team how they have helped me and supported me. I feel I am able to manage at home.

author: JEM63
title: The impression I was left with lingered
body:
I brought my elderly mother for an appointment to the hospital.  
The security guard was helpful and polite, but one member of staff appeared indifferent as I tried to help my mother put on her mask and get into a wheelchair. Another member of staff in the same area, was talking and laughing loudly.I hold the NHS in very high regard and have had excellent service when being treated at any time in the past. Unfortunately the impression I was left with yesterday lingered.

author: Westie16
title: Admission to ward 21
body: Whilst working I was over come with severe chest pain...within 2 hours from first bit of pain I was admitted in to ward 21. The care I received was excellent! With being an NHS staff member myself we’re not the best patients ..but within short period of time in the ward I received X-ray, blood tests, ultrasound of heart then abdomen, I could not fault any staff member from auxiliaries to nurses, domestics to consultants (medical and surgical) within 24 hours of admission, there was a plan set out for myself. all be it ruled out as cardiac but under surgical. Even once cardiac issues were ruled out all staff worked along side surgical to ensure there was a plan. so as I sit and wait for a gallbladder removal I’m forever greatful for the staff in 21 for taking such good care of me and helping me stay calm in quite a worrying and scary situation (especially with being alone)

author: Kerry21
title: Everyone was lovely and put me at ease
body:
I recently had planned surgery for removal of a cyst. I was very anxious about my first time going for surgery but all the staff including the nurses, the anaesthetist and the doctors put me at ease along the way.  
After the surgery I was in a lot pain and spent a few days in the ambulatory care ward. One nurse in particular, Julie, was great was so friendly and caring she made a difference in my hospital stay. I then had to have a second surgery Dr Holmes and Dr Huda couldn’t have been any nicer everything explained to me and made sure I knew what was happening along the way. I came out of theatre and spent 2 days in ward 6 everyone was lovely and can’t thank the staff enough for making my hospital stay as pleasant and comfortable as could be.

author: alphacq87
title: Healthcare staff at vaccination centre
body: All of the staff at Dunfermline East Church were so friendly and helpful. I mentioned that I have a fear of needles and am prone to fainting because of this and they were so reassuring. They stayed with me the whole time, having lovely chats and distracting me while getting the vaccine. Each member of staff was so nice and warm towards me, making me feel very comfortable. They all made the experience so easy, I really appreciated everything they did. Thank you!

author: Roxasneo44
title: 1st Vaccination Appointment
body: I was booked in the Dunfermline East Church appointment location and was greeted by friendly staff who quickly saw to me and handled my vaccination within minutes. The process was easy and painless. I appreciate the help I was given.

author: Becjn68
title: Covid-19 vaccine
body: I had the first dose of my vaccine today at Dunfermline East Church. Every single member of staff was friendly and made me feel welcomed. One of the gentlemen working was hilarious when we were waiting for the 15 minutes after our vaccine. Thank you all so much for your hard work!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: SB981
title: Covid jag
body: Felt fine, everyone who seen to me was brilliant and made the whole thing feel easy and less nerve wracking

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Lexie_fd
title: Vaccine
body: Very nice, no complaints

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: jj2307
title: Staff were respectful and very friendly
body: Attended my Covid 19 vaccine appointment at Dunfermline East Church and have to say all staff were very respectful and very friendly, was in and vaccinated straight away so no waiting about, currently sitting 15 mins before leaving as advised by the staff, and they've been very hospitable!

author: Ticktock17
title: My son's emergency surgery
body:
My son suddenly became unwell at home. On calling 999 told ambulance would not be available for at least over 2hrs! Even although symptoms deemed a likely medical emergency we were still unable to get an ambulance any quicker. As his condition worsened, again unable to get help from ambulance services. Thankfully meantime a friend was able to provide prompt transport to A&E. Once seen there, as suspected he required emergency surgery but then had to be moved by an emergency ambulance to another hospital that specialised in the time sensitive emergency surgical procedure that was required.  
Not being able to get immediate help added undue distress to an already frightening experience and became a more serious health issue due to initial delay of receiving medical attention.

author: Ticktock17
title: Son's care following emergency surgery.
body:
Following my teenage son's emergency transfer to Monklands A&E it was like he fell into an abyss! There was no communication from staff to inform me he was safely there and then heading to theatre. Then I was given misinformation about where he would be admitted to following surgery after having to make several phone calls to track his movements.  
Felt initially staff were dismissive of concerns when enquiring how he was post operation when first admitted to a ward. Felt there was a lack of sympathy or understanding to what I was experiencing as a parent especially in the current climate, not being able to be with him. This was also his first experience of being in hospital & as being an emergency situation even more frightening for him. There was no contact from staff to convey most importantly my son was well after the surgery or the surgical procedure that had been required & if successful or not!  
Once I finally spoke with a particular staff member, again I felt dismissed of concerns & questions of care I had for my son. There were no care aspects explained to my son as to wound care management & limited advice as to what precautions to take post operation. On collection of discharge prescription no explanation given re medication it contained and still no advice expressed as to post operation care.

author: phoenixwh97
title: Went very well
body: With my Mum (92 yrs old). It all went very well and was very good. Thank you!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: AF123
title: Efficiently operated
body:
A very efficiently operated event for my 2nd vaccine in lakeside complex Craigavon as was the case for my 1st vaccine.
My nurse this time was called Cynthia ... a very lovely kind lady.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: cunningham92
title: My first COVID-19 vaccination
body: I was very happy with my COVID-19 vaccination. It was quick, efficient and the staff were very helpful and professional

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Polly2021
title: Incredible support during miscarriage
body: I was absolutely overwhelmed by the support and kindness shown to me today by Nurse Sarah and Dr Junejo.I believed I had symptoms of a miscarriage and was referred to the gynaecology unit. Not only did they fit me in on the same day, which I was extremely surprised about considering the circumstances, they were nothing but kind, patient and caring. I was worried about wasting NHS resources and they couldn’t have made me feel more looked after. The examinations were handled with such care and even to be given a leaflet with 24/7 access to the unit for the following week is just beyond my expectations. I have never been pregnant before and I’m just so grateful for professionals like Nurse Sarah and Dr Junejo. They’ve made a very difficult day much less so and myself and my partner are truly grateful I had access to such amazing support. Thank you from the bottom of my heart. I will never forget the kindness you both showed today.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: magpiejj54
title: Vaccine
body: I was excited to see vaccination programme opening up to 40-44 year olds in northern Ireland

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Jb2021
title: COVID Vaccinations
body:
In January we had booked both COVID vaccination appointments at Sheffield Arena, a good 40 minute drive from Bakewell.  
Our second appointments were due within days when my phone rang and the caller from Newholme hospital asked if we would like to have our second vaccination straightaway at Newholme.  
We were there within five minutes and duly had our second jab.  
The staff explained to us that they should have finished work at 1.00pm but had stayed on to try to contact local residents in order to avoid wasting precious vaccine which cannot be returned to a fridge once it has been taken out. It was now 2.30pm and the staff had called us and waited for us well beyond the time they should have worked.  
We cannot praise them highly enough for their dedication, courteous and friendly attitude when they were clearly very tired.  
Not only did their selfless attitude avoid vaccine going to waste but it saved us a journey from Bakewell to Sheffield arena.  
We would be grateful if you would pass on our sincere thanks to the staff who stayed on well beyond the call of duty.

author: HelW21
title: My mothers care in Coathill Hospital
body:
I have nothing but praise for all the staff in Coathill Hospital. My mother was admitted when she was really unwell. By the time she was being transferred to a care home she was a different person. This improvement was a due to the dedication and skills is every single member of staff in the Glemmore Ward. I was given a daily report on her good days and bad.. I can honestly say i dont know what could have happened to my mum if it wasnt for them  
I will never be able to thank you all for what you have done for our family.  
A wonderful team .  
All my thanks

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: BillR21
title: Covid vaccination
body: The SSE Arena folks were awesome.   In and out  45 minutes total after the 15 minute wait. Thumbs up!

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: ERW2021
title: A huge thank you
body: A huge thank you to Lesley & Dominic of the Scottish Ambulance Service in Glasgow recently for their compassion, support, professionalism, patience & clinical expertise. So very grateful!

author: MarS21
title: Getting the COVID-19 vaccine
body: I attended the SSE arena to receive my vaccine and it was so professionally organised and felt so safe with all their measures. It was a really simple process to follow and lots of great staff to reassure us and give us the information we needed. Felt very much at ease at what was an anxious time.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Inanna
title: Second COVID vaccine
body:
My appointment was at the Craigavon Centre Northern Ireland.  
The process was well organised, efficient and smooth. The staff were efficient, knowledgable, patient and effective in their delivery of information and administration of the vaccine.  
I know I still have to be careful and that having an A+ blood group I understand that, if I catch COVID 19, am more likely to need admission to ICU; I have great hopes for the vaccine.  
Thank you to all the people behind it’s research & development, production, transportation, storage, delivery and administration; A FIRST CLASS JOB

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Tina859
title: Vaccinations
body: Great experience in Craigavon to get my covid vaccination. Super efficient, quick and painless!

author: Johnny1955
title: Covid vaccination
body: Great experience at Craigavon today - friendly and helpful staff provided an excellent service. The system there worked like clockwork.

author: chambre
title: Professional and compassionate
body:
2nd jab day. We arrived with wife in wheelchair and asked to proceed to a separate area where we were attended to immediately. Young volunteer said someone would be with us shortly. Within minutes staff nurse Anne took us under her wing and dealt with our vaccinations professionally and especially friendly, putting us at ease. We would like to take this opportunity to praise the staff at Southlakes for a very professional but compassionate way in dealing with us during our visit, so rare these day  
Thanks NHS

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Virtual visit appointment
body: Very clear instructions. Sylvia was really nice & very helpful.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Steels
title: Feeling lightheaded
body:
Excellent speedy & sensitive  
10 out of 10

author: pagerhb94
title: A great experience
body:
My experience on receiving my second vaccination was.a great experience helped by the staffs professional attitude .They were very helpful took there time and explained everything that was happening .  
I just would like to say Thank you for your professional work in dealing with COVID 19 and the work that you all do ...  
It’s appreciated ....

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: merbr55
title: Covid vaccination
body: Excellent service, efficient, quick and friendly. 2nd 'jab' received both my wife and I. Praise and thanks to All involved. You can be very proud of the organising, delivery and heartfelt thanks of those who have went through this incredible system. Thank you.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Orfeo
title: Vaccination Clinic
body:
What an amazingly well organised service! Every aspect faultless: meet & greet, explanation of how it will work, quite possibly the friendliest & most efficient members of staff to reassure every step of the way, all the day long. I had appointments in the evening & early morning & was impressed that I was treated as a person and not just another arm to jab, despite the demands on the vaccinators during their long shifts.  
Hats off also to the behind-the-scenes staff across the organisation who make it happen every day, the appointment makers, the supplies staff, domestic & estates staff, transport drivers - it wouldn't work without you too.Thank you all. Be proud NHS Shetland! Great leadership supported by lovely resilient people - we are so lucky to have you,

author: zebrawf98
title: My father
body:
My father has been suffering from a range of conditions over many years and a recent deterioration in his heart condition meant he had been retaining a large amount of fluid which was restricting his mobility, his kidney function and more recently his lung function. He was advised to admit himself to the hospital immediately as there was no longer an option to treat him at home. His blood pressure went immediately over 200 at the news and he was pretty much resigned to his fate, which he believed was a one-way journey.  
After a number of frantic phone calls we found out that an acute care team at home was a potential option. We thought it was a pretty unlikely option given my parents live out in the country, but amazingly the Dungannon team arrived in little over an hour, with a doctor and nurse arriving to immediately get to work and the consultant following later in the day. They gave diuretic IV, took bloods, and provided my father with the reassurance he needed and a high duty of care. That continued every day over the next two weeks whilst the fluid slowly drained out of my father’s chest, lungs and legs.  
He is now back at his fighting weight, his breathing has returned to normal and he is back close to his old self. But more importantly, he now knows that when things are not as they should be there is an alternative option to hospital admission. I have no way of knowing what the outcome of my father being admitted to hospital would have been.  
Thankfully, the Dungannon acute care at team home meant that I didn’t have to think about that scenario for too long. But I do have tears in my eyes as I write it. Thank you to everyone who provided such a high level of care to my father over the past few weeks, you are all legends and a credit to your profession. Thank you, thank you.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Armagh4ever
title: How important this service is
body: Thank you so much for this amazing service! I hadn’t seen my father till today due to a family breakdown for over 15months, thankfully today I was able to see him face to face and speak to him to tell him I miss him and love him and see him laugh and smile again Thank you 💛🙏

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: TMac1
title: Sudden excruciating pain in my head
body: I went in with a sudden excruciating pain in my head that did not disappear. I also had my Covid vaccine very recently. I was seen by a doctor in A&E then a registrar who both said that it’s possible that it’s a blood clot and I would need to be kept in hospital over night. I went for a CT scan and then the doctor said I would need another one with the dye in to check for the clot. After I had that I was told that I need to have a lumber puncture in the morning as the new doctor said there is a good possibility that it’s a sub arachnoid hemorage and the only way to find out is to have a lumber puncture. In the morning the nurse came to my bed and said ok you can go home now! I said what the doctor had told me and they said that it was no longer needed and that I was fine, I said I was still in a lot of pain so the nurse got another new doctor to come to see me who had quite an aggressive manner and said that they don’t think it’s anything bad and that they need the bed!Before I could say anything they were packing my stuff and asking me to call a cab to go home. I’m still in agony. I do have to say though if this is something that they have missed and anything should happen to me my husband has everything documented.

author: JamesR
title: My dear Dad
body: My Dad had a heart attack last year but his heart became progressively weaker from the beginning of 2021. The nurses that gave Dad care whilst he was at home were amazing (couldn't have done more) and also the nurses and doctors whilst he spent his final week or so in North Devon District Hospital were the most caring and attentive I have ever come across. My family has not really had the need to rely on the NHS until now but they were all amazing. They cared for my Dad as if he were their own

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: NicoleKy
title: Vaccine clinic NDDH
body: The staff and volunteers were absolutely lovely. I had my second Vaccine! It was quick and efficient and I didn’t experience any pain while I was injected. Thank you

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: 1tx4y
title: I was dreading the surgery
body:
My son had a circumcision at Ninewells Hospital. We were not given any real information about the operation, preparation, etc until the day before surgery and this was very stressful. We didn't know he would need to fast, for example, so we hadn't been able to talk to him about this in advance. The doctor had said we would have 3 phone calls leading up to the surgery to discuss everything but that didn't happen. We had one phone call to give us the surgery date, which was bizarre and rude! A staff member called my mobile and abruptly asked if a certain date would do for my son without saying what it was in reference to - I had to ask who it was! I thought it was perhaps someone from school! When I asked where they were calling from they said Ninewells and it all began to make sense. I had a couple of questions, such as would I be able to come in with him, but they didn't seem to know anything and couldn't direct me to anyone else. They then said we would receive a call to book a covid test and would then have to isolate for 4 days. The date arrived and we still hadn't received any such call, so I spent half a day (whilst meant to be working) navigating the labyrinthine Ninewells switchboard system, it literally took a few hours and several calls to find out that someone was planning to call us the following day. This was really stressful as I was worried we would arrive for surgery and be turned back for not having had a test, so I had no choice but to spend hours trying to get the information.  
In the end we received a call booking his test for the following day in the next city, in the middle of my working day. If we could have been given more than a few hours notice this would not have been problematic, but despite having had months to plan for this we were given a few hours notice and it was a nightmare for me logistically. I can't exactly ask a friend or neighbour to cover for me. This is where I feel the NHS treats people as if they have no purpose except to be a patient. I was just expected to reorganise my life, and cause significant disruption to others in the process.  
I was dreading the actual surgery as everything seemed so utterly disorganised and people had been so unhelpful on the phone, but actually it was the opposite. Everyone was amazingly pleasant and efficient. What was fantastic was when staff spoke directly to my son. He is 7 and they treated him with dignity, not speaking over his head but actually addressing him directly. This immediately put him at ease and helped a lot. They used their first names in some cases which was good for helping him to relate and to feel that he knew who was who. We were asked the same half dozen questions in sequence by every professional who came along to introduce themselves, and I guess for children perhaps this is reassuring. It did seem a big demand on staff time and a lot of repetition! Three different medical professionals came along, one after the other, to explain that some cream was going to be put on the back of my son's hand, for example, before the cream was applied.  
The staff all seemed to like one another and there was such a positive atmosphere, with people smiling and joking with each other. What a difference that made - it felt like a team and not an institution.  
Thank you so much to everyone who was there on the day. You were lovely and you were kind and the surgery was not a traumatic experience for my son.

author: Chloe94
title: Labour of first child
body:
I was getting induced to have my first child my little boy, after a long good few hours I was in labour but unfortunately baby wasn't coping well and I had to have an emergency c section at the rah hospital, Paul was one of the nurses there and he was truly amazing I knew Paul from childhood and he introduced himself to me and calmed me down very quickly I don't remember much of the experience but Paul talking me through everything making me laugh and also kept my partner calm, during one of the scariest moments in my life Paul was a shining star who helped me along the way  
I can't thank him enough for what he done

author: MrsL43
title: My Child's visit to Day Surgery
body: My 14 year old son who has Perthes disease, had to attend the Day Surgery Unit as the Royal Hospital for Children in Glasgow. He was to have two procedures including an epiphysiodesis. We arrived at 11am and every member of of staff we met made us both feel comfortable and reassured. My son was offered ice lollies while he waited and we were regularly check if we were ok by the staff. Everyone was friendly and approachable. There was a nice atmosphere in the whole unit. After surgery the staff took great care to make sure my son was ok and he was able to go home after 4 hours.

author: RHB64
title: Well looked after
body: Attended for planned procedure, well looked after by all members of staff, treated with respect and kindness.

author: Clacks
title: Minor operation
body:
Attended Surgical skin team to get Basel cell removal. Staff greeted me and made me feel relaxed and comfortable. David and Lee Ann explained about the procedure, anaesthetic and what I’d need to do after. They were very professional and chatted throughout and ensured that I was ok. They had very high standards and everything went well with the procedure.  
I cannot thank David and Lee Ann for making my procedure quick and painless.

author: DaveMcn
title: Covid vacccination
body:
I have just received my second COVID-19 vaccination and just wanted to say how well NHS Fife organized and performed the whole affair  
I would particularly like to say how excellent the whole team at the church on Duloch were  
They were all a perfect blend of friendly, reassuring and professional  
Many thanks to all involved

author: Verythankful21
title: A real credit to the NHS
body: Had my second Covid Vaccination today at Craigavon Leisure Centre. Great staff, very efficient and caring. Didn't even feel needle go in. Thanks to everyone concerned, including the volunteers. A real credit to our NHS 🥰🥰

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Stacersmck
title: Polite and professional
body: The whole team at the SSE Arena were so polite and professional today, great set up, well done NHS!

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: LisaMcN
title: Covid vaccine
body: Had my first vaccine at SSE Belfast this morning. The whole experience was first class, a massive, massive thank you to every single person involved. I'm fully aware for the handful of people I had direct contact with there are many more behind the scenes making this all possible. From the bottom of my heart, thank you.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: kilojb47
title: Fantastic service
body: Fantastic service and set up every member of staff was fantastic

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: April46
title: Very well organised
body: The whole process was very well organized and quick from the first moment until I left. There was only one thing that annoyed me deeply: two of the staff I encountered. One was very professional and quick, but one couldn't find my name on the computer (it's a foreign name, not a problem at all), insisted in having in spelled (absolutely fine here) and then the colleague suggested (and rightly so) to use the DOB. It seemed this staff member couldn't work with the system well enough. Finally found it and commented that it is a very odd name, and that was the reason why it was hard to find, like I wasn't even there, because they said that and looked at the colleague who seemed slightly embarrassed! It is odd because it is different. Not good enough bedside manners. Please don't think I couldn't communicate with them, I have a degree in English and been here for 11 years. This staff member just didn't have good enough manners, just like I wasn't there, and that is simply rude. I felt that they seemed too inexperienced and were taking too long, so much so that their colleague said to hurry up as there was people waiting in the queue.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: medichi
title: Excellent care
body:
I was under the care of Mr Wright at QEUH over the last couple of years and underwent a number of assessments, investigations and surgical procedures. Throughout he was exemplary in his communication and practical skills, offering advice and guidance in a kind and pleasant manner. As I am now discharged from his services following successful interventions, I wanted to highlight how impressed I had been with the level of care provided.  
His team at the Vic ACH where I underwent several surgical procedures were also excellent, from pre-op assessment to pre and post op management, as well as the excellent anaesthetic teams who went out of their way to make sure I was comfortable and well cared for.

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: excellent practice
body: what can a i say a well run practice  wish all the GP were run like this this is a professional well run practice. the doctors are very friendly and caring. we should take this practice as a great N H S example. the practice  is run by a fantastic  dedicated  practice manager  well done to all the doctors and team there at hawthorn medical  centre

title: Phone line is very poor
body: Very difficult to get through at 8am or 2pm, the line is busy and can take 45min to get through. The phone waiting service is useless - please change back to the previous system where the message would tell the person where they are at the queue. Now there is just music and a waiting message, I have been on hold for ages!

title: Answerphone is not good
body: Please remove the horrible music from the calls when being put on hold! It is loud and is truly awful choice of music it triggers my anxiety every time I am on hold. I do not expect to feel worse from simply making a phone call. Please remove this terrible music.

title: What is happening with opening hours?
body:
Why the phone lines are closed when the surgery is open? See the hours published on the Hampton Health website:

Monday	08:30 - 13:30	14:30 - 18:00
Tuesday	07:00 - 13:30	14:30 - 18:00
Wednesday	07:00 - 13:30	14:30 - 18:00
Thursday	08:30 - 13:30	14:30 - 18:00
Friday	08:30 - 13:30	14:30 - 18:00
Weekend and Bank Holidays	closed	closed

The Surgery phone lines are open 08:00 - 12.45 & 14:00 – 18:30.

title: Fantastic from start to finish
body:
I visited the endoscopy unit today for a colonoscopy. I was extremely nervous but all the staff from the lovely lady at reception, the nurses and consultant put me at ease immediately.
All the staff were so welcoming and friendly and looked after me and talked me through everything which helped immensely. I would like to say a massive Thankyou to all staff involved in my care from start to finish.
The hospital is spotless and you are all a credit to the NHS!!

readBy.name: North Cumbria Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very good and safe
body: Made a appointment for a ongoing treatment and during my time at this surgery I've been made to feel very safe and looked after.

title: Great practice- fantastic online services as well
body:
This is now a much improved practice with decorated and modern physical updates to the building, local artists display in waiting room as well. I like the possiblity of Pharmacists and Paramedics available to see as well, it gives patients more chance of seeing someone, they are so knowledgeable as well.
I  use the online services ask a question and health conditions e.g.'Epilepsy' review online functions alot now, it is such a quicker and easier way to complete these simply without needing to book or even to log in.
My main feedback question RE: the online web services is could a 'free expanding box' be added to the end of the Existing health conditions review , it would be very helpful, as there is nearly always something extra random and indirectly related to my 'epilepsy review' but currently there is no way/ or text field' that I can add it to. A free text extra box would be helpful please if possible.  Currently I have to create it by doing a separate 'online ask a question' request.

title: Great hospital
body: My brother was transferred from Fairfield to Salford,and the difference in care and support was 100% better than in Fairfield.the staff at Salford were absolutely brilliant in keeping us close even though we were not able to physically be with him they did all they could to reassure us.Thankyou so much for all the effort from ICU to ward H2 where he was transferred to for few days.you were all amazing 🤩

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: denied physical and mental health care
body: i too have lived all over the UK and never known a GPs to deny physical and mental health care. Certain staff seem to deny the hippocratic oath including at least one receptionist. It doesn't get worse than power trips and ego's denying fundamental health care. If i could I would give it zero stars.

title: Great service
body: I have always had great service here, from all admin and medical staff. They have been great with my children and have communicated well throughout lockdowns etc. I would recommend 🙂

title: Great practice
body:
Best doctor. Best nurse. Best reception.
I been with them over 10 years never face a problem. They are the best Good bless them

title: Exceptionally good hospital
body: I've lived in the area for five years now and have had to visit this hospital perhaps more times than I would have liked, but every visit has been a very positive experience. The staff seem to be entirely kind and caring; receptionists, porters, nurses, consultants. A week ago I reported to Ward 7 for a day procedure. The nurses were very welcoming and made me feel a lot less anxious. Their care and kindness was really exceptional. After what was actually a minor procedure they wouldn't let me leave before providing a cup of coffee and a biscuit. The NHS at its very best.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

title: Absolutely shambolic
body:
I completed the online request for a appointment giving all the information required. 
I also stated that as I drive all day for my work, I can't take a phone call but that I did have a day off in 8 working days time. In addition, I named a doctor that I DIDN'T want to have any contact with.
I duly received a message stating that I would be contacted by phone on a date that I was working!!
I then had to phone the surgery which took 18 minutes as there were 2 calls ahead of me.
I explained my problem to the receptionist, and she read my online form and said "this hasn't been read properly AND the doctor contacting me would have been the person I named as not suitable" and she duly apologised.
The receptionist made a appointment for my stated day off, but she couldn't give me a time as the doctor would call me. She also said that if the doctor needed to see me face to face, they would make a further appointment. 
I explained that my foot problem was extremely painful and she said that the doctor might be able to see me on the same day as my phone call. 
That means that I can't arrange anything for my day off because I have no idea about the time of the phone call, or if I need a physical examination on the same day as the surgery doesn't see patients face to face, without a phone call first.
It seems the practice expects you to put a whole day on hold for what may amount to a 10 minute phone call at some time during the day!!!!!!!!!
It would appear that the practice's admin is incompetent, and is making the simplest task of making a appointment as awkward as possible. No wonder people go to hospital A&E departments instead of their doctor if my experience is representative of doctors surgery's across the UK

title: Good service
body: Polite service. Receptionist are very helpful. GPs have good listening skills and attention to details.

title: Fantastic care
body:
I attended the PIU for an infusion on 19/4/21.First impression was that the building was immaculately clean although there are works going on. The staff on the unit were all professional kind and friendly and reassuring. I was seen on time and received very good care. The nurse who provided my care was superb, although I’m sorry I can’t remember her name. 
Thank you for all you do

title: my visit to urgent care centre today
body: the GP doctor i saw tonight was very pleasant. the triage nurse i also saw when i arrived at the hospital was very kind and friendly and finally one of the nurses in urgent care centre was so kind asking for a stronger painkiller for me to have by one of the doctors, even though i had a bit of a wait, i was seen quite quick despite it being quite busy in the department.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant treatment and care
body: I sustained a head injury on Tuesday 30th March 2021 and visited A&E the same day. All staff were friendly and professional. The doctor who assessed me and the minor injuries nurse who stitched my wound were both very reassuring, professional and thorough. The stitches were very neat too! I was in and out within two hours . Thanks for a wonderful service. I feel very lucky to have access to the NHS.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Not much help
body: Carer was not very helpful or friendly. Did not seem to have any suggestions as to what may be of help. Expensive for what help was given. Not very impressed.

title: Wonderful staff
body: I came in to have a turbt, although I had to wait a while to go to theatre, the care I received was amazing. The team in theatre were exceptional, making me feel at ease, looking after me 100%. Then I was transferred to ward 20a, who aswell were amazing. Nothing was too much trouble, they made my stay feel very relaxed and pleasant.  Thankyou xx

title: Great Doctors and health care
body: I've been with this practice for 15 years and yes , sometimes you have to wait for an hour on the phone to speak to a receptionist but, when you do get through I find them to be extremely helpful and polite. I suffered with a major health issue 3 years ago and I must say all I can do is praise my gp highly. I've felt supported and understood through my recovery and 3 years on still feel the same way. You may moan about the waiting time on the phone, but I can't fault the health care and empathy I've received.

title: Great staff
body: I went there to have my little finger looked at as had a accident with a belt sander. Very helpful and under standing as had to go back on a different day to have is stitch up, cant thank them an nuff on what a great job done on saving me finger. And the work everyone there does and the hole of the nhs. Thank you

title: Amazing Team
body: My experience of ward 22 was nothing short of Amazing nothing was ever to much trouble, the team work and attention to detail and professional team from ever part of the ream they took pride in everything they did always smiling and what was a difficult situation for my self they always took time to talk and check you were ok they deserve so much praise and I'm not on my own saying that it was the feeling on the whole ward chatting to other patients . Let's hope they get there staff room soon so they get some were for a little down time in there busy schedule thanks again all Great team .

title: great practice
body: clinic was very clean staff very helpful treatment amazing would highly recommend this clinic to anyone needing treatment .

title: Excellent care at Worcester Royal Hospital
body: I was admitted to ICU with an exasperation of COPD. I was on life support for several weeks. I went into respiratory failure and the doctors told my family if I didn’t improve in a few days they recommended the machines were turned off. They had one more drug to try and it saved my life. I cannot thank the staff enough for my care. I am still here today because of their dedication and expertise. Thank you to every staff member.

title: Why would you want to go anywhere else
body: I was only in as a day patient for surgery but nevertheless I was so impressed by the efficiency and friendliness of all the staff I encountered. They simply could not do enough. Thank you one and all.

title: Above and beyond
body: My son had an operation at the Mayhill Unit last week. The care he received was absolutely amazing. Their knowledge with working with a young adult with additional needs made all the difference. Thank you Mayhill Unit GRN. With special thanks to our LD nurse.

title: Great Practice
body:
Best Surgery we have used. Doctors and nurses all fantastic, highly competent, knowledgeable and sympathetic.
Extremely well organised.

title: Always very helpful
body: Very helpful from receptionist to GP and all in between. I have been with this practice for over 30 years. I receive a helpful annual review that is always dealt with efficiently. Staff are friendly and helpful and listen to what you think your problem is.

title: Fantastic Service
body: Had an appointment to see a Nurse. I was extremely nervous about it. The Nurse I saw was fantastic and made me feel at ease. Great social distancing measures and all the staff were very helpful.

title: Very good practice  .
body: I had both eyes done in under  3 months all my questions  were answered Cleary and put my mind at ease. The staff are very professional  but you don't feel rushed I would highly  recommend  this clinic .

title: Great Practice, professional and extremely…
body:
Receptionist very friendly, booked me a call with Dr, I then found Dr very helpful and supportive over my needs. 
Thank you.

title: Fantastic thorough and kind GP
body: Visited for my daughter today and GP was brilliant. Reassuring without being dismissive. Took time to understand issue and carried out full examination. Used considered language towards my daughter to ensure she was included. A great experience.

title: Friendly and efficient
body:
From the initial pre assessment to the actual procedures everyone from the reception staff and all the medical staff were friendly and efficient.
The whole department had an air of efficiency and professionalism.

title: Maternity Antenatal Unit: DISAPPOINTING
body:
Ia am writing to vent my disappointment for The RVI Maternity Antenatal Unit. I called them twice a week ago because I had  strong abdominal pain which interfeared with my daily activities. The MAUI staff were very quick to dismiss my worries and pain. They  suggested taking a worm bath and paracetamol tod deal with this. I was incredibly surprised that they didn't take pelvic pain seriously, especially in a 42-year-old woman with a history a miscarriages as I am. Are a warm bath and paracetamol a cure? How did they know that everything was fine? I called them to understand the origin of the pain and to be reassured, of course, on the basis of some scientific approach. The day after I called 111 and I had more support and help from the emergency doctor, who asked me to go to the hospital. He thought I could have a urine infection and I started antibiotics  while waiting for the results to come in. On Monday I called the MAU again telling about the pain and asking for some help. They thought that my phisical presence there wasn't necessary, that probably I had a urine infection and that I could take again paracetamol to relieve  the pain.  Few days later I learnt that I had no infection. 

They again, totally neglected my worries and the fact I was in distress. 

Currently, I still have abdominal pain and this morning  I also had some brownish discharges. I called again the MAU and they once more told me that it was OK and it wasn't necessary to be checked. I am going to change maternity Unit, of course, and I hope that everything is going to be fine. 

I wasn't just surprised by the superficial medical approach and how lightly they took the responsibility to say to a 42 year old woman witj a history of miscarriages to stay home and take some pain killers. I was also surprised that they totally disregarded my feelings and distress. I thought that they should take into account this too, especially in a moment when you're extremely vulnerable. But, let's be honest, nobody really cares about your mental health, a part from when they have to fill a form during the first midwife appointment.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Second Covid Vaccination, excellent service
body: Just had my second Covid vaccination and as with first one the service was first class from arrival to leaving. Considering the numbers of people passing through the service was caring and courteous with very pleasant staff dealing with people in a truly professional manner. THANK YOU!

title: Great Medical Centre
body:
We have used this practice for many years and always found them helpful and professional.
Under normal circumstances we have never had a problem getting an appointment.

title: Very efficient roll out of coronavirus vaccine.
body: Prompt invitations to attend for vaccine. Procedures when administering the vaccine vet efficient. Excellent arrangements for social distancing and avoidance of queues.

title: Great practice
body: Well looked after and competent medical staff, all my questiions were answered and all my needs were met

title: Great Practice
body: Phone appointments with Doctors have been excellent. Same day call back amazing and I have had no issues in getting a telephone appointment

title: First class service
body: From greeting to departure, a friendly and helpful attitude from all staff with a  good sense of humour and cheery manner . Bravo .

title: Excellent service
body: Dealt with very professionally on the phone and really helpful Doctors pre call after my initial call to the surgery.👌

title: a good practice to visit .
body: In spite of being a big practice with many patients, I have always felt secure and well informed and not least professionally treated .
